page.title: 03St.John's Church, Swindon
page.content: The church was built in 1854 by James Perry.It is a small parish church built of stone with a timber roof.It does not have a tower or spire.It is dedicated to St.John the Evangelist. By the door is a stone font where babies are baptised.Opposite the door is a window commemorating Perry.It shows Solomon holding a church and the Queen of Sheba holding an empty treasure chest.Other windows show James Raven (1st Vicar of Swindon),Bishop Lonsdale,who consecrate the church and the dead of the two wars The East Window shows Jesus the Good Shepherd and there is a very modern window to St.Cecilia.At the front of the church are the lectern and pulpit. In the Sanctuary (holy place) is the altar where Communion is celebrated.On the altar are two candles showing Jesus is the light of the world.There is a lady chapel in memory of Mrs.Craine.
